RXR, RAR, and Egr1 bind to the promoter of both flotillins, while RAR only bound to flotillin-2 promoter. the transcription factors RAR, RXR (Fig. 9C and D), Egr1 (Fig. 9E and F) and SRF (Fig. 9G and H) confirm a species-conserved transcriptional regulation of flotillins by these transcription factors. mutations of binding sites for the RXR family or Egr1 impair flotillin-2 transcription. the RXR binding sites were individually mutated using extension overlap PCR [31], whereas the Egr1 binding sites which are located close to each other were deleted. single mutation of the RXR family binding sites did not abrogate the transcriptional activation of the reporter constructs upon RA stimulation. however, when the mutations of the RXR binding sites 2 and 3 were combined with a deletion in the 3′ region removing the Egr1 binding sites, the transcriptional activation flotillin-1 and flotillin-2 are direct transcriptional targets of growth factor-induced MAPK-signaling, mediated by Egr1 and SRF, and 2) nuclear receptors that dimerize with RXR. flotillin expression is controlled by MAPKs, most likely through Egr1 and SRF activation. flotillin-1 is a novel MAPK scaffolder that is essential for full ERK activation. ERK1/2 dimerize and translocate to the nucleus where they bind to and phosphorylate transcription factors such as Elk-1 [39]–[41], c-Myc [42] and c-Fos [43] which then induce the transcription of several target genes. c-Fos, Elk-1, and c-Myc are genes that regulate cell cycle progression. a knockdown of flotillin-1 in HeLa cells resulted in a reduced basal as well as EGF-induced cyclin D1 expression. in general, activation of the Raf/MEK/ERK cascade is associated with increased proliferation, and a dysregulation thereof is a hallmark of many tumors. Egr1 downregulates its own expression [60], resulting in termination of Egr1-regulated gene expression. the potential role of Egr1 in cancer is not fully understood, since Egr1 has been shown to either promote [61] or suppress cell proliferation and/or cancer progression in a cell and tissue specific manner. in-silico analysis of mammalian genomic flotillin-1 and -2 sequences revealed 19 different, species-conserved putative transcription factor families. retinoic acid regulates gene expression by acting as a ligand for the nuclear receptors RAR (all-trans retinoic acid) and RXR (the all-trans retinoic acid metabolite 9-cis retinoic acid) retinoid X receptor RXR is able to control the function of many nuclear receptors. PPAR plays a critical role in adipogenesis and fat storage. drosophila flotillins are most abundantly expressed in the embryonic nervous system [73], suggesting a morphogenic function. flotillin-1 and flotillin-2 knockout mice are viable, fertile, and morphologically normal. phenotypes observed after flotillin depletion or overexpression in cultured cells may not directly reflect the essential nature of flotillins in multicellular organisms. flotillins are extremely well conserved between species that are not closely related. tillins were able to identify flotillins as transcriptional targets of MAPK signaling, mediated by the transcription factors Egr1 and SRF. retinoic acid, RXR, RAR and PPAR exert positive effects on the expression of flotillins.
